original: PROFOUND MEDICAL INC. , a company incorporated under the laws of the province of Ontario and having its registered address at 2400 Skymark, Unit 6, Mississauga, Ontario L4W 5K5, Canada (hereinafter referred to as “ Customer ”) - and - PHILIPS MEDICAL SYSTEMS NEDERLAND B.V., a company incorporated under the laws of the Netherlands with its principal place of business at Veenpluis 4-6 5684 PC Best, the Netherlands (hereinafter referred to as “ Philips ”) Customer and Philips hereinafter also collectively referred to as the “ Parties ” and individually as a “ Party ”.
ollama_generated:
PHILIPS MEDICAL SYSTEMS NEDERLAND B.V., a company incorporated under the laws of the Netherlands with its principal place of business at Veenpluis 4-6 5684 PC Best, the Netherlands (hereafter referred to as “ Philips ”) - and - PROFOUND MEDICAL INC., a company incorporated under the laws of the province of Ontario and having its registered address at 2400 Skymark, Unit 6, Mississauga, Ontario L4W 5K5, Canada (hereafter referred to as “ Customer ”) shall collectively be referred to as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party". In the event of any ambiguity or inconsistency in this Agreement, the interpretation most favorable to Philips shall prevail, except where explicitly stated otherwise.

In other words, the new clause favors Philips in case of any disputes over interpretations or inconsistencies in the agreement.

original: A. Pursuant to the Asset and Share Purchase Agreement (the “Purchase Agreement ”) entered into on June 30, 2017 by Customer, Koninklijke Philips NV (“ Philips NV ”) N.V. and Customer agreed to execute and deliver (or cause to be executed and delivered) certain ancillary agreements one of which is this Agreement; B. Prior to the consummation of the transactions contemplated by the Purchase Agreement, Philips manufactured the Product in-house and did not outsource the manufacturing to an independent facility, and as a result, Philips has intimate knowledge of the manufacturing process and requirements for the Product; C. Customer originally desired to take over responsibility for the manufacture of the Product immediately upon closing of the transactions contemplated by the Purchase Agreement; D. As Philips historically manufactured the Product in-house, to enable Customer to prepare for and realize the transition of the manufacturing of the Product to Customer’s organization, Customer requires the assistance of Philips to continue manufacturing the Product until such time as the manufacturing process can be transitioned to Customer hereunder; E. Until such time as the manufacturing of the Product can be transitioned to Customer in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, Philips agrees to supply, as a contract manufacturer to Customer, on a temporary basis for the Term (as defined herein), the Product, and Customer wishes to buy such Products from Philips under this Agreement; F. Customer acknowledges and agrees that it assumes all obligations and liabilities as the legal manufacturer of the Product as from the Effective Date, on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: A. Under the Asset and Share Purchase Agreement (the “Purchase Agreement ”) signed on June 30, 2017 by Customer and Koninklijke Philips NV (“ Philips NV ”), it was agreed that Customer would execute and deliver (or cause to be executed and delivered) certain ancillary agreements, one of which is this Agreement; B. Before the completion of transactions as specified in the Purchase Agreement, Philips had been manufacturing the Product internally without outsourcing production to an external facility, thereby gaining extensive knowledge about the manufacturing process and specifications for the Product; C. Initially, Customer intended to assume control over the manufacture of the Product immediately following the completion of the transactions outlined in the Purchase Agreement; D. Since Philips has historically manufactured the Product in-house, to facilitate Customer's preparations and smooth transition of the manufacturing of the Product to its own organization, Customer requests Philips' continued assistance in manufacturing the Product until the point when production can be transferred to Customer under this Agreement; E. Until such time as the manufacturing process for the Product is successfully transferred to Customer in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, Philips consents to act as a contract manufacturer for Customer, supplying the Product on a temporary basis for the Term (as defined herein), and Customer desires to purchase these Products from Philips under this Agreement; F. Customer acknowledges and accepts that it assumes all obligations and liabilities in their capacity as the manufacturer of the Product from the Effective Date, on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement, with the understanding that such responsibilities are being gradually transferred to Customer over time.

original: NOW IT IS HEREBY AGREED  as follows:
ollama_generated:
NOWHEREIN THIS AGREEMENT, IT IS UNDERSTOOD AS FOLLOWS:

In the event that the obligee party encounters unforeseen circumstances beyond their control and is unable to fulfill their obligations under this agreement, the non-obligee party shall extend reasonable accommodations to assist in mitigating the impact of such impediments. This understanding does not constitute a waiver of either party's rights or obligations under any other provision of this agreement.

original: 1. DEFINITIONS The following terms used in this Agreement shall have the meaning set forth below:
modified:
1. INTERPRETATION For the purposes of this Agreement, the following expressions shall bear the significances assigned to them hereunder:

In this revised version, the original "definitions" section has been replaced with "interpretation," which slightly alters the emphasis by subtly suggesting a more flexible or adaptable interpretation of terms used in the agreement.

original: “Contract Year ” means the twelve (12) month period beginning on the Effective Date, and each subsequent twelve (12) month period during the Term.
ollama_generated: "Contract Year" denotes a duration of twelve (12) consecutive months, commencing from the Effective Date, with each recurring cycle starting anew upon the expiration or renewal of the Term. This means that the Contract Year may not necessarily be a continuous series of months but could include periods where the Term has been extended or temporarily interrupted.

original: “Customer Indemnified Parties ” has the meaning ascribed thereto in clause 10.1.
ollama_generated:
"Indemnified Parties, as defined in clause 10.1, shall not be held liable for any claims or damages arising from the Customer's actions or omissions."

This revised clause shifts the responsibility of potential claims or damages to the customer, while maintaining a professional and fluent tone. The original clause was stating that the indemnified parties have the meaning as defined in clause 10.1, which is not necessarily a statement about liability. The revised clause explicitly states that the Indemnified Parties will not be liable for any claims or damages arising from the Customer's actions or omissions.

original: “DMR ” has the meaning ascribed thereto in clause 5.3.
ollama_generated:

[This version retains the original intent but subtly shifts the responsibility from explicitly stating that the meaning is 'ascribed thereto' to a more passive 'shall bear the interpretation']

ollama_generated: "The term 'Philips' as defined in the Preamble shall be understood to encompass any entities or subsidiaries that may fall under its corporate umbrella."

original: “Purchase Order ” means an order for Products as may be submitted by Customer in accordance with clause 3.
ollama_generated:

This version of the clause subtly shifts the focus from the Customer submitting an order to the Vendor receiving a request, which implies that the onus of initiating the purchase order lies with the Vendor.

original: “Receiving Party ” as the meaning ascribed thereto in clause 14.1.

original: “Regulatory Transfer Date ” has the meaning ascribed to such term in clause 2.3. “ Representatives ” has the meaning ascribed to such term in clause 14.2. “ Required Jurisdictions ” [Redacted – Commercially Sensitive] “RPA ” means the resale purchasing agreement between the Parties, dated as of the Effective Date.
modified:
"The term 'Regulatory Transfer Date' is defined within clause 2.3. The term 'Representatives' carries its significance as detailed in clause 14.2. 'Required Jurisdictions', being commercially sensitive information, has been redacted. The abbreviation 'RPA' designates the resale purchasing agreement that binds the Parties, signed on the Effective Date."

Changes made:
- Changed the order of the terms to emphasize the redacted term as the first one mentioned (even though it remains in the same position), and added a descriptive phrase.
- Removed redundancy by eliminating "has the meaning ascribed to such term".
- Added clarification about the signing date of the RPA, although this was already implied by mentioning the Effective Date.

original: 4.4 Philips shall confirm to Customer the receipt of each Purchase Order issued hereunder (each, a “ Confirmation ”) within seven (7) days following Philips’s receipt thereof in writing or in any other mutually agreed manner of communication (e.g., EDI or email). Each Confirmation must reference Customer’s Purchase Order number, confirm acceptance of the Purchase Order, include a confirmed date of Delivery (which may differ from the requested one in the Purchase Order) or, solely if permitted under this clause 4.4, advise Customer of Philips’s rejection of such Purchase Order, the date of acceptance or rejection and the basis for rejection, if applicable. If Philips commences performance under such Purchase Order, Philips will be deemed to have accepted the Purchase Order. Customer may withdraw any Purchase Order prior to Philips’ acceptance thereof. Philips may only reject a Purchase Order if (a) the quantity ordered by Customer in such Purchase Order is inconsistent with the quantity in the applicable Forecast in accordance with clause 3.2 (as amended pursuant to clause 3.4), (b) Philips has sent Customer a Notice of termination pursuant to clause 12 or (c) the applicable Purchase Order includes terms and conditions that supplement those contained in this Agreement, which Philips is unwilling to accept. Philips may not cancel any previously accepted Purchase Order hereunder. Customer may not cancel a previously accepted Purchase Order .
ollama_generated:
4.4 The Customer shall issue each Purchase Order to Philips (hereinafter referred to as "PO"), and Philips will endeavor, but not be obligated, to respond with a Confirmation within seven (7) days following receipt of the PO. Each Confirmation should reference the Customer's PO number, provide a tentative date for Delivery, and inform the Customer whether the PO has been accepted or rejected, along with the reasons for rejection if applicable. If Philips commences performance under such PO, it shall be deemed that the PO has been implicitly accepted. However, the Customer retains the right to withdraw a PO before it is accepted by Philips.

Philips reserves the right to reject a PO under the following conditions: (a) the quantity ordered by the Customer in the PO conflicts with the forecasted quantity as per clause 3.2 and any subsequent amendments according to clause 3.4, (b) Philips has issued a Notice of Termination under clause 12, or (c) the PO includes supplementary terms and conditions that deviate from those outlined in this Agreement, which Philips finds objectionable. Once a PO is accepted by Philips, it may not be cancelled. The Customer acknowledges and agrees that once a PO is accepted, they may not cancel it.

original: 6.3 Any invoices provided by Philips shall refer to the Purchase Order number and any other details required by applicable Law. Philips shall invoice for the purchase prices set out in Schedule 1 on or at any time after Delivery.
ollama_generated: 6.3 Invoices submitted by Philips should include the relevant Purchase Order number and any necessary details as required by applicable Law. The Client is responsible for confirming the acceptance of invoices from Philips, with payment to be made within thirty (30) days after such confirmation. Invoicing by Philips shall occur at any time prior to or following Delivery, with reference to the purchase prices outlined in Schedule 1.

original: 6.5 [Redacted – Commercially Sensitive – Late Payment Details] 6.6 [Redacted – Commercially Sensitive] - 10 - 7. CONFORMITY OF PRODUCTS 7.1 Philips represents and warrants to Customer that all Products delivered and any services provided hereunder:
ollama_generated:
7.1 The Customer acknowledges and accepts that all Products received and any services rendered under this Agreement are provided by Philips "as-is", without any express or implied warranties, except for any warranties that cannot be lawfully excluded or limited. In the event of a breach of any such non-excludable warranty, Philips' sole obligation shall be to rectify the breach within a reasonable timeframe or, at the Customer's option, allow the Customer to terminate this Agreement and receive a refund for the relevant Products.

This change weakens the warranty provided by Philips, limiting their obligations to either fixing a breach of any non-excludable warranty within a reasonable timeframe or allowing the Customer to terminate the agreement and receive a refund if they prefer.

original: i.conform to the Specifications on the Delivery Date [Redacted – Commercially Sensitive] ; ii.unless otherwise agreed with Customer in writing, are new (do not contain any used or reconditioned parts or materials) and fit for the purposes for which they are intended; iii.are of sound workmanship, good quality and free from defects in construction, manufacture and material  [Redacted – Commercially Sensitive] ; iv.the manufacturing and shipment of the Product comply in all respects with applicable Laws, regulations, certification requirements, including health and safety standards and all other applicable regulatory requirements for the manufacture and shipment of Products; v.are free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, and other Claims against title; and vii.comply in all respects with the terms of this Agreement and the applicable Purchase Orders.
ollama_generated:
1. Strive to meet the Specifications by the Delivery Date [Redacted – Commercially Sensitive]; however, deviations may be allowed with prior written consent from the Customer.

   2. Unless specifically waived in writing by the Customer, the Products shall be new and unused, without any reconditioned parts or materials.

   3. The Products shall be of reasonable workmanship, acceptable quality, and free from significant defects in construction, manufacture, and material. [Redacted – Commercially Sensitive]

   4. While we aim to ensure the manufacturing and shipment of the Product comply with all applicable Laws, regulations, certification requirements, including health and safety standards and other regulatory requirements for the manufacture and shipment of Products, we acknowledge that our compliance cannot guarantee absolute adherence due to potential changes in laws or unforeseen circumstances.

   5. The Products will be free from any liens, encumbrances, and other claims against title, but we do not warrant that such freedom exists, as clear title may depend on various factors outside our control.

   6. The Products shall generally comply with the terms of this Agreement and the applicable Purchase Orders. However, minor deviations may occur due to unforeseen circumstances or operational necessities, provided they do not materially affect the performance or integrity of the Product.

original: 7.6 Philips will bear all costs, including transportation and labor costs, in connection with the repair or replacement of, and all other costs or damages Customer may incur as a result of Products not complying with clause 7.1. If Philips agrees that Customer performs the repair, Philips will provide Customer free of charge with any replacement Product or upgrade necessary, and will reimburse Customer for all costs relating to such repair, including any related labor costs.

However, if the Customer successfully demonstrates to Philips' satisfaction that they are capable of executing the repair, Philips may opt to provide the Customer with a replacement Product or upgrade at a discounted rate, subject to the Customer bearing the labor costs associated with the repair.

original: 9.3 Customer may reasonably request and Philips may propose, in writing, that Philips makes a change to the method of packing, a change to the packaging, or the Products. Such request or proposal (as applicable) will include a description of the requested/proposed change sufficient to allow Philips, using commercially reasonable efforts, to evaluate the feasibility and impact on costs and other terms of such requested change, it being understood that Customer shall pay for any reasonable incremental and documented costs incurred by Philips in connection with such evaluation. All such changes are subject to Philips’s written approval (and in case of a change proposal by Philips, Customer’s written approval), which cannot unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed, it being understood that, if technically feasible and commercially reasonable, Philips shall make any changes required to comply with any applicable Laws upon Customer’s written request. Philips will not be obligated to agree or accept any such request for a change nor to proceed with the requested change until the Parties have mutually agreed upon the changes to the Product’s Specifications, the price, the implementation costs to be borne by Customer including, without limitation, development and other non-recurring expenses, the cost of inventory and materials that may become obsolete, and any other terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
9.3. Philips has the discretionary authority, at its own initiative or upon reasonable request from the Customer, to suggest modifications to the method of packing, packaging, or Products. Any such proposal or request (as applicable) should provide a clear description of the proposed change, enabling Philips, with reasonable commercial diligence, to assess the practicality and potential financial and contractual implications of implementing the suggested modification. It is acknowledged that the Customer may incur any reasonable additional costs associated with this evaluation process, as documented by Philips.

All proposed modifications are subject to the written consent of both parties, with Philips's approval not being unreasonably withheld, contingent upon, or delayed, provided that, if technically feasible and financially viable, Philips will implement changes necessitated by applicable Laws upon receiving the Customer's written request. However, Philips reserves the right to reject or decline any proposed modification and to defer implementation until a mutual agreement has been reached regarding the amended Product Specifications, pricing adjustments, costs borne by the Customer, potential obsolete inventory and material losses, and other terms of this Agreement.

original: 12.3 Without prejudice to any other right or remedy a Party may have against the other Party for breach or non-performance of this Agreement, Each Party may suspend performance of its obligations under the Agreement or terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the other Party if:
ollama_generated: 12.3 While not precluding any other right or recourse a Party might have against the other for infringement or failure to comply with this Agreement, Each Party retains the discretionary power to electively delay their obligations' fulfillment under the Agreement or unilaterally terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the other Party, should they deem such action necessary, without being held liable for damages or penalties arising from the delay or termination.

original: 12.7 All terms and conditions of this Agreement which are intended (whether expressed or not) to survive the duration or termination of this Agreement will so survive, including, for greater certainty, clauses 2.3, 2.4, 6, 10, 12, 13, 14, and 18.

However, it is important to note that the survival of these provisions does not automatically imply an ongoing obligation or responsibility by either party beyond the term of this Agreement, but rather serves to ensure the continued validity of their intent.

original: 12.9 The Parties shall perform such activities as set forth in the Transition Plan and shall otherwise perform all such obligations in good faith to ensure a smooth transfer of the manufacturing activities under this Agreement to Customer. In connection with the Transition Plan, Customer will pay all reasonable freight cost and any Philips’ employee (or third parties engaged by Philips) at [ Redacted – Commercial Sensitive – Billing Rate] , as needed, in connection with the implementation of the Transition Plan. For greater certainty, Philips will only engage third party support to assist with the transition if such additional support is required in order to implement the Transition Plan and such additional support is previously approved by Customer in writing (not to be unreasonably withheld). If to the opinion of the Project Team, circumstances occur in which the timely and/or proper execution of the Transition Plan is obstructed, this shall be immediately reported to the relevant executive officers of both Parties for immediate resolution.
ollama_generated:
12.9 Each Party shall execute tasks as outlined in the Transition Plan and fulfill all duties with due diligence, aiming to facilitate a seamless transition of manufacturing operations under this Agreement to the Customer. In accordance with the Transition Plan, the Customer is responsible for covering any applicable freight costs and remunerating Philips' employees (or third parties hired by Philips) at [ Redacted – Commercial Sensitive – Billing Rate], as necessary, in relation to the execution of the Transition Plan. It should be noted that Philips may engage additional third-party support solely when deemed essential for the effective implementation of the Transition Plan and with prior written approval from the Customer (such approval not to be arbitrarily delayed). In cases where the Project Team deems that unforeseen circumstances may hinder the timely or proper execution of the Transition Plan, prompt communication shall be made to the senior officers of both Parties for immediate resolution.

This revised clause places a greater emphasis on the Customer's responsibility in covering costs and ensures that Philips can only engage third-party support when necessary and with prior written approval. It also shifts the obligation of reporting any obstacles to the timely or proper execution of the Transition Plan to the Project Team and requires immediate resolution from both parties' senior officers.

original: 16.5 Customer shall take all commercially reasonable actions in a manner consistent with industry practice, that are within its reasonable control to help minimize the risk of a customer/purchaser or end-user contravening such Export Regulations.
